intro: Cassia mannii var. vanhouttei, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its long, pendulous inflorescences that bear numerous golden-yellow flowers, which bloom throughout the year in warm climates. The plant has compound leaves with alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaflets, and its bark is smooth and light gray in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The tree is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils.
